column1: With Rod Wood set to retire today after more than 50 years in broadcasting including 44 years at @NewsChannel9 I spoke on the floor of the House to honor his remarkable career in journalism. https://t.co/zNxTUSBvgh
This morning my wife Robin and I lent a hand to the volunteers at the @RescueMission. https://t.co/673REJPNcG
https://t.co/KGzZQx3JE3

I disagree with the President. With lives at stake we cannot afford to stop negotiations on a relief package. The Problem Solvers Caucus has a proposal that both sides agreed on and can bring negotiators back to the table. I strongly urge the President to rethink this move.
https://t.co/BS4hCJB9Ig

After the Syracuse City School District and Onondaga County Public Libraries fell victim to major ransomware attacks I responded by introducing the State and Local Cybersecurity Improvement Act. Today I’m pleased to report the House passed my measure. https://t.co/0GuvBB3OLC
https://t.co/qMUufwCAUL
https://t.co/Mbq40QF1ag
https://t.co/3iSnhifIKV
https://t.co/HjECZ708u0
https://t.co/0MfHTSVTZV
Robin and I offer our deepest sympathies to Justice Ginsburg's family friends and all who loved and admired her.

She was a trailblazer in the fight for equality and worked tirelessly to make our nation a more fair and just place. Justice Ginsburg was a strong and passionate voice on the Supreme Court and will be forever remembered in the decisions she authored.

Tonight our nation is deeply mourning the passing of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. While we come from different parties I have always admired and had the utmost respect for Justice Ginsburg.

Happy Rosh Hashanah to everyone in Central New York celebrating the Jewish New Year tonight. Whether you’re spending the holiday with family and friends or connecting over Zoom I hope everyone has a happy and safe celebration. https://t.co/4Oyn1zTNtv

I’m honored to receive the first-ever Aviation Security Guardian Award from @ACC_HQ. This award recognizes my work on the Homeland Security Committee to pass bipartisan legislation that protects airports and keeps traveling Americans safe. https://t.co/KoEDoxo7Pg
https://t.co/NgNWDM2uCE https://t.co/fOIRG8xZHB
https://t.co/V1ADzaBQHe

On the 19th anniversary of September 11 2001 the Town of DeWitt held a ceremony honoring those who lost their lives during the attacks and the brave men and women who aided in recovery efforts. Our nation will never forget. https://t.co/wCGAKaZoa8
These officers are now in critical condition fighting for their lives. Robin and I are praying for the officers and their families. https://t.co/CtHIWhdiEc

The shooting of two LA County Sheriff’s deputies is reprehensible. We must hold the assailant accountable to the fullest extent of the law and strongly condemn the actions of those who blocked the entrance to the hospital and wished death upon the officers as they arrived.
Today on the 19th anniversary of 9/11 let us all take a moment to reflect on the memory of the fallen and to pay tribute to those who made incredible sacrifices.

Our nation will never forget the thousands who lost their lives on September 11 2001 the brave first responders who rushed to save so many or the members of our military who in the wake of these attacks served to defend our freedom. https://t.co/23nm5bu6uo
https://t.co/ejiK38BRsk
By offering support to neighbors in-need sharing resources and encouraging those struggling with mental illness to seek treatment we can prevent suicide and save lives.
If you’re struggling know that resources are available. The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline offers free confidential crisis counseling at 1-800-273-TALK (8255).

The economic uncertainty and emotional toll of the current pandemic have only worsened the mental health crisis in our country.  We must continue our work to reduce stigma increase access to treatment and reach out to those who might be suffering.

Today is World Suicide Prevention Day. Sadly in our country suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death for people ages 10-34 and the 10th leading cause of death for all Americans. https://t.co/EzcrTT3XIc

I stopped by Oswego Subshop today and talked with Bill Greene Sr. Recently celebrating its 50th anniversary this family business is now run by Bill’s son. Today it still operates at its original location and continues to be a beloved business in the Oswego community. https://t.co/J6yt0e9WIQ

In Clay I toured the site where the new @amazon fulfillment center is being built. This warehouse will be one of the largest in the world and will create thousands of new jobs. I’m very excited for this project and believe it has the potential to transform our region. https://t.co/8d1E5Q0ftq

I encourage anyone who is experiencing difficulty receiving the relief they are due to RSVP by email to NY24RSVP@mail.house.gov . In the email participants must include their name phone number and address. The deadline to register for this important workshop is Thursday at 5pm.

On Friday at 10:30am I’m hosting an EIP workshop with a representative from the IRS. We’ll also address issues with the delivery of 2019 tax returns and discuss the status of taxpayer services amid the pandemic. https://t.co/m0DltQZkKx

Today is International Overdose Awareness Day.  Central New York has long suffered from the impact of the opioid epidemic.  We must continue to raise awareness and enhance access to prevention and treatment for substance use disorders. #IOAD2020 #CutOutOverdoses

Meal delivery services like Meals on Wheels are more important than ever. That why I’m leading a bipartisan effort calling for $1.1 billion in COVID-19 relief funds for senior nutrition services and other programs offered through the Older Americans Act.   https://t.co/7BHUI4oRfY

Congratulations to @Astro_Jeanette! A graduate of @SyracuseSchools & @LeMoyne she will spend six-months on the ISS making her the first Black female astronaut to serve as a crewmember on the orbiting space laboratory. Our community will be cheering for her the entire way. https://t.co/cgfp6phlGo

Yesterday at @flcc_connects in Newark I worked with the folks at Food Link Inc. to distribute food to over 300 households. It was great to help out and hear that many of the meals we provided were supplemented by the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. https://t.co/H9QFDPuPyV
https://t.co/KeSB2XbEDE

I introduced a bipartisan bill that addresses local concerns over the lack of resources local govs have to hire election security experts. As we approach the General Election state and local governments must have the resources to ensure the integrity of our democratic processes. https://t.co/Wk51dAq11U

The Presidential Election in Belarus was anything but legitimate. Presient Lukashenko must hold transparent and fair elections and immediately end the violent response to citizens peacefully protesting and journalists reporting on the election.  https://t.co/SeIvdABTUk
https://t.co/1rI6WUa6oH

It’s time for the White House and Congressional Leaders in both parties to come back to the negotiating table. We need a COIVD-19 relief package that delivers additional support for working families healthcare providers small businesses and state and local governments. https://t.co/xr9SFE7e8R
https://t.co/iVoaJmlZCl
https://t.co/2BJO4YJGyk
Great article highlighting the career and work of my friend @AuburnPolice Chief Shawn Butler. https://t.co/D4Z3OPmV5j

I’m pleased to announce @helio_health has received more than $400K in federal funds to expand its Join It Live It Be It program which creates training opportunities for those seeking to work in behavioral health as a certified volunteer or counselor. https://t.co/1HzHvni7Lh
I urge Governor Cuomo and New York State to immediately provide the public with this information. Families deserve answers.

State officials have the ability to access these numbers but have failed to make them public. Sadly this is only further evidence of the state’s devastating approach to addressing COVID-19 in nursing homes.

New York is the only state in the country with major outbreaks that does not count nursing home residents who succumbed to the virus in a hospital towards the overall number of nursing home resident deaths.
It’s troubling to learn that New York State’s tragically high nursing home death toll could be even higher due to the state’s flawed counting method.  https://t.co/8T7XEcJvaf

The partisanship and posturing must end. With our communities still suffering from the devastating impacts of the pandemic Congress needs to set partisan politics aside and work together to deliver relief. https://t.co/q9IgtAzlLf
https://t.co/6UXxJDUSOU

Great news from Byrne Dairy. This week they broke ground on a new processing and production facility. This project will allow them to expand their local production capabilities and will create 64 new full time positions as well as 125 construction jobs. https://t.co/cYEHDpyGAs

ICYMI: Amid ongoing negotiations in Congress on the next COVID-19 relief package I penned an op-ed in the @thehill highlighting the need to deliver additional funds to state and local governments. https://t.co/b9gNOyPRDv

Right now I’m holding an important Telephone Town Hall. I’m taking questions from Central New Yorkers and providing an update on the status of COVID-19 relief legislation in Congress. https://t.co/FbDwQwGRNL
https://t.co/3F3i9t7jFx

To protect the health and safety of Central New York seniors I’m leading an effort to urge Congressional Leaders to provide additional funding for local skilled nursing homes and assisted living facilities. https://t.co/BrdH7KnHBq

It was great to be on the @FederalNewsNet’s Federal Drive with Tom Temin to discuss my work as Ranking Member of the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity Infrastructure Protection and Innovation. Click on the link below to listen to the full interview. https://t.co/4p7I6HTtOp

Last week I broke with my party to support the Child Care is Essential Act and Child Care for Economic Recovery Act.  Our community’s economic recovery is dependent on strong support for working parents and robust investments in our childcare system. https://t.co/UfGVFz4NMK

Congress should not leave Washington without addressing  unemployment benefits and providing additional relief to local hospitals businesses and families. We need to get this done. https://t.co/aXev0Ysoqr
https://t.co/LJHEMs5Zf2 https://t.co/xkpSUKpJBA

With the economic uncertainty surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic I’m working with Republicans and Democrats to ensure funding remains available for local infrastructure projects. https://t.co/EBuY8SukaP

To continue flattening the curve we need buy in from young adults in our community. Avoiding large gatherings wearing face coverings in public and social distancing remain critical to combating this pandemic.   https://t.co/i8RuQxh6Sa
https://t.co/cCYzqC8z9i

Tonight I spoke on the House Floor to honor the life and legacy of Congressman John Lewis. An icon of the Civil Rights movement dedicated public servant and friend – John Lewis will be dearly missed in the Halls of Congress. https://t.co/ocfmYFuB9U

Reminder: At 1pm I’ll be hosting a Facebook Live discussion with @RepBrindisi. We will take your questions and discuss our bipartisan work to deliver results for Central New York. I encourage everyone to listen in! https://t.co/N4DIjlEmFI
https://t.co/It4EJ47NrP
Click on the link below to listen to a live Telephone Town Hall I’m holding for seniors in Central New York. https://t.co/FbDwQwGRNL

Today our nation mourns the loss of John Lewis an icon of the Civil Rights movement who dedicated his life to fighting for equality.  He was an American hero who never wavered in his pursuit to make our country a more fair just place.  My full statement: https://t.co/h8Ci638Wz4 https://t.co/5uThvvWoK0

Ahead of tax day tomorrow I led a bipartisan effort with @RepBrindisi to urge the IRS to deploy a strategy that provides necessary flexibility to struggling taxpayers and allows for the efficient delivery of tax refunds amid the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/6pR2j1oAR0

The PPP has helped save nearly 200000 local jobs in Central New York with 9154 loans delivered to small businesses across our region. This program is working in Central New York and will remain critical as our community and economy continues to recover. https://t.co/R42wOKOWdq

Thanks to everyone who participated in my Telephone Town Hall last night. We discussed the need for continued support for small businesses working families and hospitals & heard from folks on the dangerous impact of New York’s bail reform on local communities. https://t.co/3vtcLOQiR8
As Congress looks to consider an additional COVID-19 aid package this month  I’m continuing to lead Republican efforts to deliver aid for state and local governments. https://t.co/42Lc3xPDx6

I wanted to take a moment to wish everyone in Central New York a very happy Independence Day. As we reflect on our nation’s founding 244 years ago remember that we have overcome seemingly unsurmountable challenges many times before and can do it again. https://t.co/Yx4oLlsc9i

Today with @RepBrindisi I led a bipartisan effort urging the IRS to take immediate steps to address confusion surrounding the agency’s delivery of Economic Impact Payments (EIPs) by debit card. https://t.co/Mdl7dlolbR

With the USMCA going into effect this week I urged the U.S. Trade Representative to ensure its provisions are strongly enforced. We owe it to our agricultural industry to uphold the protections they were promised. https://t.co/HXIlVl9jgK
https://t.co/koQJ0U09bX

I am pleased to announce the @ProbSolveCaucus has endorsed my bill the JOBS Act. In an effort to strengthen the economy and save local jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic my bill takes steps to improve and expand the Employee Retention Tax Credit (ERTC). https://t.co/C3QS86vj8i
https://t.co/ELiftImumx
This is not over. The Administration must do a better job responding to the threat of coronavirus as we continue to see spikes across our country.   https://t.co/tIkBevpKqm
https://t.co/CdxI6U9Juw

More than ever Central New Yorkers are relying on telehealth services to safely access treatment for mental health & substance use disorders. That’s why I’m pleased to announce @AccessCNY has received $134000 through the FCC’s COVID-19 Telehealth Program. https://t.co/fm6Hnrg4wA

I’m pleased to see @sendavidperdue and @SenatorSinema introduce companion legislation to my bill the Cybersecurity Advisory Committee Authorization Act in the Senate. With bipartisan support in both chambers Congress must pass this commonsense measure. https://t.co/k0t5yf8Z9W
https://t.co/6MofGw3WOM
https://t.co/764Blt2Dnz

Join me now for a live telephone town hall I’m participating in with @AARPNY . I will be taking questions from callers on the line and providing an update on my latest efforts to support seniors during this crisis. To listen in click on the link below:   https://t.co/1qCZ1CQ76I

This year I’m excited to announce Margaret Hunt a senior at Westhill High School has been named the winner of the Congressional Art Competition for the 24th Congressional District. Her piece entitled ‘The Horse of Inis Mór’ will be showcased in U.S. Capitol for a full year. https://t.co/7TB0uQmd8e

I’m honored to receive the @USChamber’s first-ever Jefferson-Hamilton Award for Bipartisanship. With CNY and our nation facing historic challenges we must develop consensus on meaningful reforms while working to deliver additional relief to those impacted by the pandemic. https://t.co/LsDlnkF2K0

I am pleased to announce that $2.5 million in CARES Act funds will be directed to @OnondagaCounty and the @Syracuse1848 to help individuals and families who are homeless amid the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/oFb2Vqwf9v

The Class of 2020 has persevered through unprecedented challenges and deserves to properly celebrate this momentous accomplishment alongside family and friends while adhering to important public health guidance. https://t.co/K4jyKJ389r

Today on the 76th anniversary of D-Day we recognize the soldiers who bravely stormed the beaches of Normandy in 1944. Thank you to our heroic veterans as well as our current servicemembers and their families for you all you do to serve and protect our nation. https://t.co/pwZt1MdeA9

I joined members of the Auburn Rotary for this week’s milk giveaway at the Auburn Town Center Plaza.  This effort helps local dairy producers while supporting our community during these challenging times. Thanks to all the volunteers who joined and Auburn Rotary for organizing. https://t.co/J0AIpDlxgA
https://t.co/SsAgIS26QW
https://t.co/C4By6M8Thc
https://t.co/9Rj4UkAKPa
I released the following statement after passage of H.R. 7010 the Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act bipartisan legislation I co-sponsored and supported in the House. https://t.co/cC1pfdfRo7

I was incredibly saddened to learn of the passing of my friend and former colleague Congressman Sam Johnson. Sam was an incredible public servant who always carried himself with grace dignity and humor. God rest his soul. https://t.co/FUOm9HFiks

Wishing everyone in Central New York a happy and safe Memorial Day. While this year we won’t be celebrating with Memorial Day parades or ceremonies I visited the Veterans Memorial Park at Gille Lake to pay my respects to our community's fallen military personnel. https://t.co/vjauMlD8pF

I was pleased today to join @OnondagaCounty Executive Ryan McMahon Mayor Walsh from @Syracuse1848 and other local leaders in announcing that @amazon will be launching a new fulfillment center in Clay. https://t.co/qUbvuTUYmo
https://t.co/EMotfHUu8z

After leading a bipartisan push to urge the IRS to restore customer service operations I am pleased today to announce that a new phone number has been created to answer questions related to Economic Impact Payments. For questions related to these payment please call 800-919-9835
It was great to join @PeaceIncSyr to help deliver meals to homebound seniors and to visit with them. https://t.co/bwh16l8nbo

Attention Central New York Farmers & Producers: On Thursday May 14 2020 at 1 pm the @USDA will host an informational webinar on how to apply for direct payments through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP). https://t.co/mUiQdbiSa2
Great initiative by the @SyracuseCrunch to support COVID-19 relief efforts in Central New York. Together we will be back stronger! https://t.co/AqzdtmnQWh

Honored to receive recognition today as the second most bipartisan Member of Congress by the non-partisan @TheLugarCenter. As our country faces one of the greatest challenges of our lifetime it is more important than ever before that we work across party lines. https://t.co/FuGbHAegxA

ICYMI: I penned an op-ed published in the @The_Citizen outlining my bipartisan advocacy to support Cayuga County throughout the COVID-19 pandemic and to urge the enactment of policies to ensure our region has the necessary tools to recover. https://t.co/Sa41Bj6qCG

Happy Mother’s Day to all the mothers and grandmothers across CNY! While this Mother’s Day may look a little different I hope you’re able to take time to enjoy the day. Today I’ll be thinking of my mother Mary Lou and celebrating my wife Robin and mother-in-law Shirley. https://t.co/nWRpC3SjNA

I called on the @USDA to expand access to nutrition assistance programs for working families who are struggling during the COVID-19 pandemic. As a result of this advocacy I am pleased to announce that the USDA has approved NY’s request to operate the Pandemic EBT program. https://t.co/EsTDnY7MFQ

@SBAgov has announced that farms and agricultural businesses may now apply for COVID-19 relief through the EIDL. For more information on applying for disaster assistance click on the link below.https://t.co/5Nv3qoW0I9
https://t.co/Y9bFJl8I8S

The Port of Oswego Authority plays a critical role in supporting the CNY economy and contributes greatly to the security of our supply chain. That’s why I’m joining @RepBrindisi to lead a bipartisan push for the Port of Oswego and ports nationwide. https://t.co/mnCOTW7bzn
https://t.co/kKJyGxTEKV

It was great to join @politico for a conversation on cybersecurity. We discussed my role as Ranking Member of the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity the bipartisan bills I introduced and the need to strengthen cyber protections amid the COVID-19 pandemic.     https://t.co/DnIhNUwYwF

Our nation has the opportunity to grow and put thousands of workers like @GoIUPAT members back to work when the pandemic subsides. As we rebuild our economy we should be investing in infrastructure projects that strengthen our roads bridges and support our medical facilities.

Tonight at 7pm on @NewsChannel9 I will be joining Democrats and Republicans from NYS’s Congressional Delegation for a virtual bipartisan town hall on COVID-19. We will be taking questions from Central New Yorkers and viewers across the state and discussing the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/pG5hcN84nc

My bipartisan bill the Resident Physician Shortage Act would add 15000 resident spots to Medicare’s Graduate Medical Education Program— ensuring communities nationwide have access to care amid the COVID-19 pandemic and strengthening our nation's healthcare system. https://t.co/L3yRe5Yub8

At 2:30pm I will be joining @SenGillibrand and Dr. Corona from @UpstateNews for a bipartisan virtual town hall on the COVID-19 pandemic. We will be answering questions on the COVID-19 pandemic and providing an update on our recent bipartisan efforts in Congress. https://t.co/7SpwEUHrxy

Happy Earth Day! In Central New York our lakes streams and forests are local treasures. In Congress I will continue to do my part to advance bipartisan measures that protect and preserve our environment for future generations. https://t.co/KndSLN05Xd

I am pleased that the IRS and U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs are now acting on my request to automatically send Economic Impact Payments to recipients of non-taxable VA benefits. https://t.co/nViYIyMiFr
https://t.co/dYrM0mD1r7

I am proud to join @RepSamGraves Ranking Member of @TransportGOP in introducing legislation that aims to increase internet access in rural communities by allowing them to more readily use EDA grants to develop high-speed broadband. https://t.co/iy1JCwEWML

I urged the @IRSnews to simplify the recovery rebate process and I am pleased to see this agency act swiftly in announcing that Supplemental Security Income (SSI) recipients will now receive their Economic Impact Payments automatically. https://t.co/XivfUfxutO
https://t.co/6WygjQC29x

It was great speaking with @SPECNewsCNY on my proposal to establish a bipartisan commission on U.S. pandemic preparedness and response. Click on the link below to view our full discussion.https://t.co/K0i5MHsKx5
https://t.co/Vb8bexXOq5

Eli Harris was a Marshall Street and Syracuse legend. Like so many in our community I was incredibly saddened to learn of his passing. He was a gifted musician and an absolute joy to see preform. Our community will miss his music and vibrant personality. https://t.co/UsGkB7rw2r

Now more than ever it is imperative we expand telehealth services to ensure those struggling with mental health and substance use disorders have access to quality care. That’s why I am leading an effort to urge @CMSGov to immediately expand telehealth access for CNY seniors. https://t.co/snZ2HAVzV4

I would like to wish our Jewish friends and neighbors Chag Sameach as Passover begins this evening. While this year's celebration may look different and be spent apart from loved ones the spirit remains unchanged. I wish you health peace and joy today and throughout the year. https://t.co/cXUy2wPr5p

Today I am pleased to announce that @HHSGov has awarded $1.6 million in Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act funding to Syracuse Community Health Center and East Hill Medical Center.https://t.co/ZVmuU2jwxY

Please join me today at 1:30pm for a Telephone Town Hall. Together with representatives from St. Joseph's Hospital and the Federal Trade Commission we will discussing the Coronavirus and how to avoid and handle scams during this pandemic. https://t.co/FbDwQwGRNL
https://t.co/ujZRYmmoN7

I am working with @RepBrindisi to urge @HHSGov to immediately direct a proportional amount of newly appropriated CARES Act funding to support hospitals in CNY. To flatten the curve and stop the spread of COVID-19 we have to provide immediate support to our local hospitals. https://t.co/QkubM11TwA

To ensure local businesses and 501c3 non-profits have access to important resources and federal programs that can help provide relief during this crisis I created a comprehensive packet that can be viewed below. https://t.co/BeiBY98dot
https://t.co/f2vLZkm4bW

Glad to be on @NewsChannel9 last night to discuss the CARES Act a bill that will provide relief to working families and small businesses in CNY and ensure frontline providers have the necessary resources to protect themselves and care for patients.  https://t.co/BWmDesn2Ja

Our number one priority has to be addressing the shortages in medical supplies that hospitals and medical facilities in Central New York face. Without sufficient supplies we handcuff the response effort and leave frontline providers vulnerable to infection.https://t.co/U0yXTivzAG

A great story from the The Citizen. With the Coronavirus now dramatically altering everyday life for our community now more than ever it is imperative we lend a hand to our neighbors in-need. Together we can and will get through this. https://t.co/oeCDkyWYFm

Thanks to everyone who listened in last night and to my guests Karen Belcher from @FoodBankofCNY and Dr. Robert Corona from @UpstateNews. We provided listerners with an update on the ongoing coronavirus pandemic while answering questions and clearing up misconceptions. https://t.co/zYjP7sUrK3

With widespread efforts underway to prevent the spread of Coronavirus I recognize the toll this is taking on many small businesses and CNY’s workforce. My website has important information and resources for small businesses accessible at the link below. https://t.co/KnMhPBjWmD

Right now I'm hosting a Telephone Town Hall on the Coronavirus with specialists from @UpstateNews and @FoodBankofCNY. To listen in or ask a question please click the link below.  https://t.co/KAgbUMdsgO

I called on the @IRSnews to issue an extension for the tax filing deadline due to the Coronavirus – and I’m glad to see this agency act swiftly to do so by moving it to July 15th. We must continue to take all necessary steps to provide relief to CNY.  https://t.co/gIrfGN0USC

To ensure health care workers in Central New York are able to stay healthy and remain on the frontlines to combat the Coronavirus pandemic today with @RepBrindisi I urged @HHSGov to prioritize sending a proportionate share of supplies to our region.  https://t.co/sf3jraD2mO

With a growing percentage of our workforce now teleworking as Ranking Member of the @HomelandGOP  Cybersecurity Subcommittee I issued a cyber resource guide to ensure CNY has the information and resources to protect themselves against cyber threats.   https://t.co/ohZVI0Dwv4

@UpstateNews launched this important resource for CNY. If you have a Coronavirus-related question are showing possible symptoms or may have had an exposure to someone diagnosed with Coronavirus please call their line at (315) 464-3979. Note: this is a non-emergency line. https://t.co/N6eSkUDbCK

I voted last week in support of emergency funds to address the pandemic and today I am glad to announce $16.6 million in funding from the @CDCgov will be distributed to communities in Central New York and across New York State.  https://t.co/ChtL90F6r0
https://t.co/qUG0U501jl
https://t.co/YQGVsX2QfR

To provide you with the latest information on the Coronavirus and preventative steps you can take to protect yourself and your family I’ve updated my website to include helpful links and information.  https://t.co/ohZVI0Dwv4
https://t.co/8aNSbUMKUs

As Ranking Member of the Subcommittee with jurisdiction over @fema I was pleased to meet with @FEMA_Pete about the importance of providing relief to shoreline communities along Lake Ontario and the need to improve our nation’s disaster mitigation and recovery programs. https://t.co/zg5OEYkeqh

It was great meeting with a @wwp rep from Syracuse in my DC office. In Congress I am working to honor the great sacrifices CNY veterans have made for our nation by helping veterans re-integrate into civilian life and ensuring veterans get quality healthcare and support. https://t.co/IcOfbRVUzv

It was a pleasure joining National Grid the City of Syracuse OCWA - Central New York's Water Authority and local cybersecurity experts for the inaugural @threatxchange meeting. https://t.co/eNY0BdvCwK

Proud to be featured by the @RiponSociety in the latest edition of the Ripon Forum. We talked about my recent efforts to improve access to mental healthcare in CNY and discussed my record of passing bipartisan legislation.  https://t.co/DIyw1ZGNkr

Along with @RepBrindisi @RepJoeMorelle I sent a bipartisan letter to Chairs Jane Corwin and Pierre Beland of the International Joint Commission (IJC) requesting that outflows from the Moses-Saunders Dam be maintained above Plan 2014 limits.  https://t.co/HgoD65bsKP

I was grateful to meet with local mental health advocates and clinicians from @AccessCNY at Provisions Bakery & Restaurant in Syracuse. We discussed the importance of ending the stigma associated with seeking mental healthcare and the need to improve access to care in CNY. https://t.co/4kdJoj1U7F

Following an announcement by DHS that it has suspended its Global Entry and Trusted Traveler programs for NY residents in response to NY's new ‘Green Light Law I’ve urged Cuomo to prioritize the safety of NYS residents by working with DHS to make reforms  https://t.co/ubGH3ztRFI

On the 81st anniversary of the Collins Block Fire today our community honored the firefighters who died battling this fire as well as the 45 firefighters who have been killed in the line of duty while serving the city of Syracuse. https://t.co/l1KKp9lIfj

It was a pleasure meeting with employees at Cayuga Milk Ingredients today. As producers of high-quality milk products I am proud to stand alongside these Central New York farmers and producers and to work on their behalf in Congress. https://t.co/ZdMJgNzfVm

This morning I met with my Agriculture Advisory Committee in Cayuga County. We discussed my support for the USMCA and how this bipartisan trade agreement will benefit dairy farmers in Central New York and our region’s agriculture industry as a whole. https://t.co/ptimJobAw8

I applaud the House Homeland Security Committee for approving the CISA Director Reform Act bipartisan legislation I introduced which aims to empower CISA by creating consistency and stability within the agency.  https://t.co/o9S2U1hJ87

Today on International Holocaust Remembrance Day I was proud to vote in support of the Never Again Education Act— bipartisan legislation I cosponsored to promote Holocaust Education efforts in schools across the country.

With communities across Lake Ontario’s southern shore still recovering from record flooding experienced in 2017 and 2019 it is critical that the IJC take substantive steps to prevent further devastation to coastal homes businesses and infrastructure.  https://t.co/F9UlyH77BY

Thanks for having me! Saab employs hundreds of Central New Yorkers and manufacturers products that are essential to our national security. I am committed to working in Congress to ensure local employers like Saab have the tools they need to keep thriving. https://t.co/z1GeplAILD
It was my honor to assist the family of Mr. Ernest J. Carhart in obtaining a posthumous Purple Heart Medal honoring Mr. Carhart’s service and to present it to them today. https://t.co/IGGwgP9JEl

This weekend I joined the Vietnamese Community of Syracuse for the second annual Lunar New Year festival in Syracuse. This celebration of Vietnamese culture and tradition featured food games and entertainment. It was great to be in attendance! https://t.co/YmzQYVDD5J
